evidence_extraction:
[
  "I'm a Black Nationalist freedom fighter.",
  "The political philosophy of black nationalism only means that the black man should control the politics and the politicians in his own community.",
  "if you're black, you should be thinking black.",
  "expand it from the level of civil rights to the level of human rights.",
  "When the government of South Africa began to trample upon the human rights of the people of South Africa they were taken to the U.N.",
  "how can the plight of everybody on this Earth reach the halls of the United Nations",
  "I see some enemies.",
  "racial powder keg sitting in your lap, you're in more trouble than if you had an atomic powder keg sitting in your lap.",
  "If you don't see it you're finished. If you don't see it you're going to become involved in some action in which you don't have a chance.",
  "And it will take black nationalism to bring about the freedom of 22 million Afro-Americans, here in this country",
  "black nationalism is the key.",
  "the only way we're going to solve it: we got to unite.",
  "The Man is becoming richer and richer, and you're becoming poorer and poorer.",
  "Anytime you have to rely upon your enemy for a job, you're in bad shape.",
  "The white man, the white man is too intelligent to let someone else come and gain control of the economy of his community. But you will let anybody come in and control the economy of your community...",
  "(No direct evidence of mudita)",
  "All of us catch hell from the same enemy.",
  "The government itself has failed us. And the white liberals who have been posing as our friends have failed us.",
  "Uncle Sam, with the blood of your and mine mothers and fathers on his hands. With the blood dripping down his jaws like a bloody-jawed wolf.",
  "Mr. Moderator, Rev. Cleage, brothers and sisters and friends",
  "We got to unite. We got to work together in unity and harmony.",
  "We both got the same objective, we just got different ways of getting' at it.",
  "Revolutions overturn systems. Revolutions destroy systems.",
  "it'll take black nationalism today to remove colonialism from the backs and the minds of twenty-two million Afro-Americans",
  "to take that government to the world court and accuse it of genocide and all of the other crimes that it is guilty of today.",
  "the black man should control the politics and the politicians in his own community.",
  "we will have to carry on a program... of reeducation – to open our people's eyes, make us become more politically conscious, politically mature.",
  "this philosophy... designed to bring black people together and elevate black people, join that church... that's based on lifting the black man up and making him master of his own community."
]
